intro: Gagea eleonorae, commonly known as the Eleanor's spring beauty, is a small, flowering plant belonging to the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of the western United States, particularly in California and Oregon. The plant features delicate, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers in early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers sunny to partially shaded environments. Gagea eleonorae is often found in open woodlands and rocky slopes, where it contributes to the biodiversity of its habitat.
